<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Yithian](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1373)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Yithians are strange creatures, defined not by their physical bodies but by their ancient, disembodied minds. As a people, yithians devote themselves to the acquisition of knowledge above all else. They project their minds across the cosmos and take over a creature's body, living within and observing the creature's culture. The yithians then reverse the process and return to their communities, recording all they learned in massive tomes crafted of strange, metal alloys.

 Yithians erase their hosts' memories of time spent in their bodies; however, these hosts occasionally recall odd images, usually during dreams. These recollections often involve a vast city from which great black towers rise, filling the viewer with dread. Few hosts realize these vague memories harken to their time spent in the yithian's body, when they wandered that alien city.

 Four flexible and retractable appendages radiate from the top of a yithian's cone-shaped body, two of which end in sharp pincers, which they click and move to communicate, while the third ends in a cluster of funnel-shaped sensory organs. A spherical “head” rounded by three evenly-spaced eyes tops the fourth appendage. Tentacles dangling beneath this head allow for fine manipulation that the large pincers can't manage, while the crown of tentacles rising from the top like strange flowers function as ears.

<title level="2" right="Creature 9">[Yithian](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1373)</title>

<traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Bestiary 3](/Sources.aspx?ID=66) pg. 299</row>

**Perception** +21; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), thoughtsense (imprecise) 60 feet

**Languages**
[Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Yithian](/Languages.aspx?ID=74); 20 other languages; [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=37) 100 feet

**Skills**
[Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2) +19, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +14, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +18, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) +21, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) +19

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +4

**Dex** +1

**Con** +4

**Int** +6

**Wis** +5

**Cha** +1
</row>

**Thoughtsense** ([divination](/Traits.aspx?ID=47), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) The yithian senses all non-[mindless](/Traits.aspx?ID=108) creatures at the listed range.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 27 [all-around vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=1)

**Fort** +19 

**Ref** +14 

**Will** +20 

</row>

**HP** 112

**Resistances**
acid 10, cold 10, fire 10, physical 10

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 20 feet, climb 10 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
pincer +19 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [deadly d10](/Traits.aspx?ID=174)),
**Damage** 2d12+7 bludgeoning

**Occult Innate Spells** DC 28, attack +20
- **5th**
[Hypercognition](/Spells.aspx?ID=156), [Mind Probe](/Spells.aspx?ID=193), [Mind Reading](/Spells.aspx?ID=194) (at will), [Mindlink](/Spells.aspx?ID=195) (at will), [Modify Memory](/Spells.aspx?ID=200) (×3), [Paralyze](/Spells.aspx?ID=213), [Touch of Idiocy](/Spells.aspx?ID=341)
- **7th**
[Possession](/Spells.aspx?ID=225) (see mind swap)

**Mind Swap**   When a yithian successfully casts [_possession_](/Spells.aspx?ID=225), they exchange their mind and soul with the target. Each creature takes control of the other's body. This effect lasts until the yithian Dismisses the spell or they're forced out by any effect that ends _possession_. When the effect ends, each creature's mind and soul returns to its own body, regardless of physical or temporal distance, and the yithian can cast [_modify memory_](/Spells.aspx?ID=200) on the target to remove any or all knowledge of its time being possessed. If the yithian is forced out of the target's mind by an effect, the yithian can't remove such knowledge.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Immortality via Theft</title>

Yithian's current conical forms aren't the species' original appearance. The creatures long ago learned how to forcibly swap minds with other creatures. Their more frequent use of this ability to observe and learn seems innocuous, but long ago, extinction threatened the species' original bodies and planet. To survive, yithians organized a mass mind swap with a species on another world, dooming those creatures' minds to die in their original bodies while yithians continued their existence in the cone-shaped forms they bear today.
</aside>
